content.data: Add a Paneled Back to the Back of a Cabinet
Draw a Peninsula Wall, drag and drop Cabinet(s) into place on both sides of the Wall.
FAQimage47.gif
We are going to create a panel from an actual Cabinet.

Select the Cabinet that you want to be the panel and take the Cabinet to the Section Editor. 
 
 
 Go to the option  Modifications | Default Assembly  and click Yes.
Select the Cabinet that you want to be the panel and take the Cabinet to the Section Editor.
Select the Cabinet that you want to be the panel and take the Cabinet to the Section Editor.
Go to the option  Modifications | Default Assembly  and click Yes.
Go to the option  Modifications | Default Assembly  and click Yes.
image782.png
image808.png

While in Section View, go to the option  Modifications | Hide Parts  and select Case Parts, Interior Parts,
        Toe Parts.

While in Section View, go to the option  Modifications | Hide Parts  and select Case Parts, Interior Parts,
        Toe Parts.

While in Section View, go to the option  Modifications | Hide Parts  and select Case Parts, Interior Parts,
        Toe Parts.
image809.png

Go to the Properties tab in the ribbonbar and select the Toes option and change the Toe Height to 0. 
 
 
 Select the Bottom Rail and change its Width to cover the Toe to your shop specifications. 
 
 
 You can now add Doors and Mid Stiles and Rails using the Section Editor. 
 
 
 Use the Return option in the ribbonbar to return to the Plan View of your Room. With the Cabinet still selected, change the Cabinets depth to .
Go to the Properties tab in the ribbonbar and select the Toes option and change the Toe Height to 0.
Go to the Properties tab in the ribbonbar and select the Toes option and change the Toe Height to 0.
Select the Bottom Rail and change its Width to cover the Toe to your shop specifications.
Select the Bottom Rail and change its Width to cover the Toe to your shop specifications.
You can now add Doors and Mid Stiles and Rails using the Section Editor.
You can now add Doors and Mid Stiles and Rails using the Section Editor.
Use the Return option in the ribbonbar to return to the Plan View of your Room. With the Cabinet still selected, change the Cabinets depth to .
Use the Return option in the ribbonbar to return to the Plan View of your Room. With the Cabinet still selected, change the Cabinets depth to .
image6040.gif
You have now placed a panel on the back on your Cabinet that can be sized to fit multiple Cabinets.
You have now placed a panel on the back on your Cabinet that can be sized to fit multiple Cabinets.
You have now placed a panel on the back on your Cabinet that can be sized to fit multiple Cabinets.
image6041.gif
Utilizing this method with the  Wainscot Panel FAQ  you will have total control.
